Additionally, Best Buy has deals on other popular Nintendo titles, including Mario Kart 8 Deluxe and The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild. The upcoming Switch 2 will be backward compatible with existing Switch games, and more details will be revealed in a Nintendo Direct stream on April 2.

author: andy.chalk@pcgamer.com (Andy Chalk)
title: Two days after laying off US-based developers, NetEase says Marvel Rivals has surpassed 40 million players
description: Marvel Rivals continues to do big numbers, which probably comes as cold comfort to former employees of NetEase's Seattle studio.
content:
NetEase has announced that its hero shooter *Marvel Rivals* has surpassed 40 million players and recently topped the Steam charts, following a successful Season 1 update in January 2025. The game launched on December 6 and quickly gained over 10 million registered users within 72 hours.

Despite the success of *Marvel Rivals*, NetEase reported a slight decrease in gross profit for Q4 2024, bringing in RMB16.3 billion (US$2.2 billion), down from RMB16.8 billion (US$2.3 billion) in the previous quarter. This decline was largely attributed to reduced revenues from mobile games, although PC game revenues, including *Marvel Rivals*, partially offset the downturn.

Following layoffs in its US-based development team for *Marvel Rivals*, NetEase stated that the core team remains in China and continues uninterrupted work on the game. The layoffs have sparked speculation about their connection to geopolitical tensions and operational challenges in the US gaming market. Niko Partners analyst Daniel Ahmad noted that domestic Chinese studios have become more efficient, achieving success with smaller teams and lower budgets.

The situation reflects a broader trend in the gaming industry, where large studios like Electronic Arts have also reduced staff following project completions, underscoring the challenges of high costs and long development cycles.

author: Blair Marnell
title: Tales Of The Shire: A Lord Of The Rings Game Has Been Delayed Again
description: There's a famous line in J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Rings where Gandalf the Grey explains that a wizard is never late or early. Instead, "he arrives precisely when he means to." Video games, on the other hand, are another ma…
content:
Tales of the Shire: A Lord of the Rings Game has been delayed again, with a new release date set for July 29. Originally scheduled for March 25, this delay is aimed at ensuring "the same cozy experience" across all platforms, as developers Private Division and Wētā Workshop want the game to "feel like a warm hug from Middle-earth."

Unlike traditional adventure games, Tales of the Shire focuses on the peaceful lives of Hobbits rather than epic quests. Players can create their own Hobbit character, build a home, and engage in activities such as farming, gardening, decorating, and trading with other residents.

The game will be available on Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, and PC. Early previews have highlighted its charm and good fundamentals, with hopes for necessary improvements in the final version.

author: andy.chalk@pcgamer.com (Andy Chalk)
title: Sony shares examples of 'sexually charged' texts from former Destiny 2 director who claims Bungie fired him unfairly to avoid paying millions
description: Christopher Barrett sued Sony in December 2024, saying he was fired after a "sham investigation" because the company didn't want to pay out the $45.5 million remaining on his contract.
content:
Sony has responded to a wrongful dismissal lawsuit filed by former Destiny 2 and Marathon game director Christopher Barrett, stating that his termination in 2024 was "justified" and that his lawsuit is "meritless." Sony cites several examples of Barrett's communication with female subordinates, which it claims demonstrate a pattern of misconduct, including alleged drunk calls and inappropriate comments. Barrett's lawyers argue that Sony is misrepresenting these interactions.

Barrett claims that Sony damaged his reputation by publicly suggesting he engaged in sexual misconduct, leading to his firing. He alleges that the real reason for his termination was to avoid paying him over $45 million owed under his employment agreement and to deflect attention from the company's business failures.

In its response, Sony asserts that it conducted a thorough internal investigation into Barrett's behavior, which indicated that he targeted female employees with inappropriate comments about their appearance and pushed boundaries. Sony describes Barrett's attempts to create an unprofessional level of intimacy, including demands for participation in sexualized games and unsolicited late-night communication.

Despite earning more than $38 million during his time at the company, Barrett denies any intentional wrongdoing and expresses that he believed he was respectful toward his colleagues. He stated he never intended to make anyone uncomfortable and would apologize if he did. However, Sony maintains that Barrett ignored multiple requests to stop his conduct.

author: Lan Pitts
title: A Pair Of Great Star Wars RPGs Are Free For Android Owners Right Now
description: Following its recent launch, the mobile Epic Games Store is continuing to roll out free games on Android worldwide and iOS in the European Union. Two new arrivals are particularly good ones worth picking up.From now until March 20, Star Wars: Knights of the O…

The mobile Epic Games Store is currently offering free games on Android worldwide and iOS in the European Union. From now until March 20, players can download **Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic** and **Knights of the Old Republic II** for free. These games, released 20 years ago, have become iconic in the Star Wars RPG genre.

Additionally, the Epic Games Store added nearly 20 third-party games last month and plans to offer new games each month until transitioning to a weekly schedule later this year. Epic Games has also grown its cross-platform accounts to 898 million users in 2024.

In recent news, two members of Epic's board had to resign due to conflicts of interest with Tencent, and the company is suing an alleged cheater in Fortnite tournaments for using unauthorized software.

author: Autumn Wright
title: Lost Records: Bloom & Rage Tape 1 review
description: Lost Records is Stand By Me for the Rebel Girls.
content:
**Lost Records: Bloom and Rage** is a game that feels like a spiritual successor to *Life is Strange*, focusing on supernatural elements and coming-of-age themes through the lens of female relationships. Set in Velvet Cove, a small and somewhat desolate town in Michigan, the game's narrative revolves around the memories of its female protagonists, particularly their 16th summer in 1995, before life changes them irrevocably.

The gameplay involves exploring nostalgic artifacts from girlhood—such as trolls, VHS tapes, and diaries—which serve as remnants of the past rather than puzzles to solve. The protagonist, Swann, uses a camcorder to record her surroundings and create a film, offering a personal glimpse into her experiences and connections with others. The storyline captures the essence of memory, exploring how relationships shape individual lives and recollections.

As the plot unfolds, time manipulation is employed to weave past and present, leading to reflections on identity and nostalgia, especially in the context of queer childhood experiences. The game portrays the past in a romanticized yet eerie light, critiquing the nostalgia of the '90s while connecting with audiences who resonate with those formative years. 

Overall, *Lost Records* dives deep into memory, relationships, and the complexities of growing up, wrapped in a narrative that prompts players to consider their own nostalgic yearnings and the reliability of memory.

author: Zack Zwiezen
title: New Call Of Duty Map Is Teasing The Next Tony Hawk Game
description: Another day, another piece of evidence that seems to indicate we are getting a new Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater game in the near future. This time it’s a teaser found in a new Call of Duty Black Ops 6 map. Read more...
content:
**Update: 02/21/2025, 2:40 p.m. ET:** Activision has added a countdown timer to the official Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater website, hinting at a new game reveal.

A teaser in the new Call of Duty Warzone and Black Ops 6 mid-season update included a skate shop map called "Grind," which features a poster of the original Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater logo and the date March 4, 2025. This seems to indicate a connection to an upcoming Tony Hawk game, with Tony Hawk himself reacting with eyeball emojis on social media.

Activision previously published Tony Hawk’s games, and this appearance in Call of Duty suggests corporate synergy. There have been previous hints of a new Tony Hawk title, including claims from a skateboarder involved in the last game and comments from Tony Hawk about his collaboration with Activision.

Additionally, reports indicate that Microsoft plans to announce and release a new Tony Hawk game, potentially titled "Project Chicago," during a summer Xbox event, focusing on a remaster of Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3 and 4.

Fans are eagerly anticipating further details as the March reveal date approaches.

author: Blair Marnell
title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Patch Lets Players Keep Pouring The Wine
description: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 hasn't even been out for a month yet, but the wildly successful game already has another patch ready to go from Warhorse Studios. Although there are a handful of crash fixes, there aren't many major issues at all in this patch, whi…
content:
**Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Patch Update: Hotfix 1.1.2 Overview**

Warhorse Studios has released a new patch, Hotfix 1.1.2, for Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2. This update includes several crash fixes and focuses on stability improvements and quest fixes. A notable enhancement addresses an issue in The King's Gambit quest, where players can now continue pouring wine for the king after previously experiencing the option to pour disappearing.

Key changes include:

- **Fortuna Quest**: Bozhena and Pavlena will no longer report the player for crimes during the quest.
- **The King's Gambit**: The quest interactor for wine will remain available, allowing players to fulfill the king's request for wine.
- **Combat**: Fixed the crossbow aiming zoom for ultrawide resolutions.
- **Epic Games Store**: Resolved an issue with achievements not completing after prolonged playtime.
- **General improvements**: Enhanced stability and the issue with rewards sometimes requiring a game restart to be awarded.

Since its release, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has achieved significant success, selling 1 million copies within the first 24 hours and surpassing 2 million sales overall, with a peak of 250,000 concurrent users on Steam. Upcoming official mod support for the PC version has also been announced.

author: Alice Jovanée

author: Brendan Hesse
title: GeForce RTX 50-Series Graphics Cards - Where To Buy New Nvidia GPUs
description: Nvidia's lineup of GeForce RTX 50-Series Graphics Cards expanded this week with the arrival of the 5070 Ti, which joins the higher-end 5080 and 5090 models that launched late last month. Just like those two GPUs, the 5070 Ti is hard to find in stock at Amazon…
content:
Nvidia's GeForce RTX 50-Series Graphics Cards expanded this week with the release of the 5070 Ti, joining the previously launched 5080 and 5090 models. The 5070 Ti is currently difficult to find in stock at major retailers but is priced at $750. The standard 5070 GPU is expected to launch by the end of February.

The flagship RTX 5090 is priced at $2,000 and is claimed to be twice as powerful as the RTX 4090, requiring a 1,000-watt power supply. The RTX 5080 is priced at $1,000 and reportedly delivers double the performance of the RTX 4080, while the budget-friendly RTX 5070 offers performance comparable to the RTX 4090 at a lower price of $550.

The RTX 50-Series leverages Nvidia's latest machine learning technologies, including RTX Neural Shaders and DLSS 4, which upscale lower-resolution gameplay to higher resolutions and include Multi Frame Generation, producing additional frames for smoother gameplay. This technology allows for smaller, more affordable GPUs that still achieve high-end gaming results despite having less raw processing power compared to previous generations.

However, AI upscaling and frame generation come with tradeoffs, such as potential inconsistencies and input delays. Nvidia and game developers are working to address these issues, and the RTX 40-series has already shown significant performance improvements using these technologies. Additionally, RTX 50-Series laptop GPUs are expected to launch in March.

author: Samuel Roberts
title: Dynasty Warriors: Origins review
description: 1v1000 battles get a serious shot in the arm.

The gameplay delivers a blend of exhilarating battles against hordes of enemies with fast-paced mechanics that make every skirmish feel lively and impactful. author: Zack Zwiezen
title: GTA V On PC Finally Catches Up To Console Versions
description: In 2022, Rockstar released the PS5 and Xbox Series X/S versions of Grand Theft Auto 5 and GTA Online. These ports looked better, played better, and included new content and graphical options. And now, finally, three years later, Rockstar is bringing all of th…
content:
In 2022, Rockstar released enhanced versions of Grand Theft Auto 5 and GTA Online for PS5 and Xbox Series X/S, featuring better graphics and new content. Now, a free update bringing these improvements to PC is set for March 4, 2023.

The update will include new ray tracing options, faster loading times, and support for advanced upscaling technologies like FSR1, FSR3, and DLSS3. It will also support DualSense controllers and deliver higher resolution and framerate options. 

Additionally, new content for GTA Online will be added, including vehicle upgrades, animals on the map, a career progress feature, and improved menus. PC players will also have the option to subscribe to GTA+, which provides various bonuses and free games.

Rockstar confirmed that players who upgrade to the new PC version will get a one-time character transfer option, but those transferring will not be able to play with users who haven't upgraded. Both the original and upgraded versions of GTA V will be available on PC, allowing for multiplayer compatibility based on the version being played.

This update marks a significant enhancement for PC players as they await the eventual release of GTA 6, which will not be available on PC at launch.

author: tyler@pcgamer.com (Tyler Wilde)
title: Among Us 3D will make the VR version playable without a headset, and it's coming 'soon'
description: It will have crossplay with the VR version, and there'll be a demo very soon.
content:
A new version of Among Us, titled Among Us 3D, is set to be released. This version will adapt the existing VR experience for non-VR gameplay, allowing players without a VR headset to enjoy a first-person version of the original 2D social deduction game. 

Developers Innersloth and Schell Games announced Among Us 3D with no specific release date, but it is noted to be "coming soon." A demo will be available this Monday as part of Steam Next Fest. 

Among Us 3D will feature the same gameplay mechanics as the VR version but will include a HUD and standard controls. Crossplay will enable players from both versions to join games together. While Among Us VR will be rebranded to align with Among Us 3D, it will remain a separate game on Steam. 

Additionally, a new currency called Stardust will be introduced in a few months to enhance player customization options and support game expansion. The Among Us 3D Steam page is now live for more information.

author: George Yang
title: Split Fiction Cross-Play And Friend's Pass Free Access Explained
description: EA and Hazelight Studios have revealed information about how Split Fiction's Friend's Pass and cross-play between different platforms work. There's even a free trial for players who don't own the game.Similar to Hazelight's previous co-op games like It Takes …
content:
EA and Hazelight Studios have announced key details about Split Fiction's Friend's Pass and cross-play features. The Friend's Pass allows players who own the game to invite friends who do not own it to play through the entire game together. Players can download the Friend's Pass on their chosen platform—PC, PlayStation, or Xbox—and must have an EA account if playing on different platforms. An in-game invite is then sent from the owner to their friend, allowing both to progress through the game together.

If neither player owns the game, they can still utilize the Friend's Pass for a free trial that includes the initial stages of Split Fiction. Both will need to download the Friend's Pass version, and progress can continue once either player purchases the full game.

While previous games like It Takes Two and A Way Out did not support cross-play, Split Fiction enables it, allowing players on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S to play together, requiring each to have an EA account. Hazelight has also established a Discord server for players seeking others to join them in the game.

Split Fiction is set to launch on March 6 for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S.

author: Chris Plante
title: A video game that helps you find more video games
description: Every month, a wonderful new video game leaps off the diving board of development, performs a flawless series of promotional flips, and then lands a stomach-splitting belly flop onto Steam. Welcome to 2025, when even the best video games can and often do cras…
content:
Ludocene is a game recommendation engine designed to address the overwhelming number of video games available. Co-founded by designer Andy Robertson, it combines elements from dating apps, deck-building games, and casual conversations with friends to help users discover new games.

The app presents users with video game cards, each containing information such as trailers and genre details. Users can swipe up to discard a game or swipe down to save it to their favorites. As users build their favorite deck, Ludocene curates a secondary deck with recommendations based on their selections.

During a demonstration, users can explore various games they might not typically encounter. For example, a user discovered "A Walk with Yiayia," a lesser-known title despite its positive reviews. 

To enhance the recommendation process, Ludocene includes an "Expert" feature, allowing users to integrate established critics and designers into their recommendations. This feature aims to balance algorithmic suggestions with human expertise.

Ludocene launched on Kickstarter with the goal of helping players find great games that might otherwise go unnoticed.

author: Andy Edser
title: Ray tracing is quickly becoming inescapable and I think it's time we bit the bullet and embraced it
description: Upscaling will always save the day. Right?
content:
Back in 2018, the announcement of the RTX 20-series graphics cards marked a significant moment in gaming history. The introduction of real-time ray tracing, facilitated by the new RT cores on these cards, promised a future where lighting in games would be calculated, reflected, and diffused in real time, greatly enhancing realism.

Since then, however, the adoption of real-time ray tracing has been slower than anticipated. It has often been an optional feature, primarily available to those with high-end hardware. Recently, some demanding games like "Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl," "Indiana Jones and the Great Circle," "Star Wars Outlaws," and "Black Myth Wukong" have emerged with ray tracing as the only lighting method, suggesting that gamers using older hardware, such as the GTX 1080 Ti, may need to consider upgrades.

We are entering an era where “RTX on” is becoming the norm. While many games still allow players to ignore ray tracing if they have outdated hardware, this may soon change as it becomes a default feature. Fortunately, technologies like DLSS and AMD's FSR have made it possible to enjoy ray tracing with smoother performance. These upscaling methods help maintain reasonable frame rates and image quality, making ray tracing more accessible even on less powerful systems.

author: Darryn Bonthuys
title: Squid Game Tabletop Adaptation Discounted To Only $18 With Amazon Lightning Deal
description: If you've ever wanted to enjoy a few rounds of IRL Squid Game at your home--and with far fewer casualties--you can now check out a great deal on the officially licensed board game. Normally $25, you can pick up Squad Game: The Board Game for just $18.49 thank…
content:
The Squid Game tabletop adaptation allows players to compete for a metaphorical $38 million prize by participating in up to six mini-games, including Tug of War, Glass Bridge, Marbles, and Red Light/Green Light. Designed for up to six players, the first person to reach the Squid Head wins. To increase chances of winning, players must keep teammates alive and work together, as surviving players split the money earned.

Each game session lasts around 45 minutes, offering a quick and engaging experience. The six games feature unique playstyles and rules, requiring players to adapt quickly to avoid elimination.

Additionally, Netflix collaborated with Spin Master Games to create an official marbles gift set, available for $15 at Amazon.

author: Billy Givens
title: How To Make The Most Of Avowed's Fast Travel
description: Many role-playing games are well-known for their sprawling worlds filled with points of interest to discover, and simply walking between all these locations over and over again can be a pretty exhausting affair. Avowed is one such massive RPG, offering dozens…
content:
Avowed is a massive RPG set in the sprawling world of the Living Lands, offering a fast travel system to ease exploration. To utilize fast travel, players must first visit camps or beacons throughout the game world. Once these locations are unlocked, players can teleport to them via the map.

To unlock a beacon, players only need to approach it until it blooms with purple fire. For camps, interaction with an Adra pillar is necessary, requiring players to set up camp and rest there to enable fast travel.

Camps also allow players to rest and upgrade, with the option to return to the camp’s location or travel back to the original spot after resting. Note that fast travel may be temporarily disabled during significant story segments, but access will be restored afterward.

Avowed is available on Xbox Series X and PC.

author: Eddie Makuch
title: Call Of Duty's New Update Is Apparently Teasing A Tony Hawk's Pro Skater Reveal
description: Call of Duty's big new Season 2 Reloaded update is out now, and fans quickly discovered that one of the maps added to Black Ops 6 appears to point to a Tony Hawk's Pro Skater reveal soon.The Grind map, which takes place at a skatepark, includes a banner that …
content:
Call of Duty's Season 2 Reloaded update has revealed a potential teaser for a new Tony Hawk's Pro Skater game. The Grind map, set in a skatepark, features a banner with "03.04.25," suggesting a possible announcement on March 4, 2025. This aligns with earlier rumors of a new remaster for the franchise expected to launch this summer.

Tony Hawk himself reacted to the teaser with an emoji, indicating that an announcement is likely on the way. The Grind map, originally from 2012's Black Ops 2, has been remastered in this update.

Additionally, the update introduces a new skateboard melee weapon. There are also hints that pro skater Tyshawn Jones may be involved in an upcoming Tony Hawk's Pro Skater game, despite no official confirmation from Activision. Speculation surrounds older Tony Hawk's titles possibly coming to Game Pass, particularly after a previous project involving Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 was reportedly rejected.

author: Jason Rodriguez
title: How Sid Meier's Civilization VII Showcases Filipino Culture Through Jose Rizal
description: On January 24, the official Twitter account of Sid Meier's Civilization VII posted a tweet that I had been looking forward to for years. In it, a man spoke these words: "Walang bansang pinagmumulan ng katalinuhan. Ito ay nagbubunga sa lahat ng lugar. Ito'y pa…
content:
On January 24, the official Twitter account of Sid Meier's Civilization VII announced the inclusion of Dr. Jose Rizal as a playable leader, marking the Philippines' official presence in the Civilization franchise. Dr. Rizal, an accomplished author, scholar, and national hero, expressed the sentiment that intellect is not exclusive to any country, resonating deeply with many, particularly given the underrepresentation of Filipinos in video games.

Rizal's character stands out as more than just a stereotypical depiction; it genuinely reflects Filipino culture and heritage. Born on June 19, 1861, he was a well-educated polymath and polyglot who studied ophthalmology to aid his mother. His travels shaped his views on governance and inspired his advocacy against Spanish colonial rule.

Rizal was a contributor to La Solidaridad, where he addressed socio-economic issues in the Philippines and authored two significant novels: Noli Me Tangere and El Filibusterismo. These works criticized the abuses of Spanish colonial authorities and the Catholic Church. Despite advocating for peaceful reform, he was executed on December 30, 1896, for alleged ties to revolutionary movements, uttering "Consummatum est" before facing his executioners. Rizal's legacy remains a powerful symbol of Filipino identity and resilience.

author: Ryan McCaffrey
title: Solasta 2 Preview: It'll Get Recognized in a Post-Baldur’s Gate 3 World, But it Must Do More
description: Solasta 2 offers smart, assiduous quality-of-life improvements over the original, but didn't do much to distinguish itself from other CRPGs on the market like Baldur's Gate 3.
content:
**Solasta II Overview**

*Solasta II*, much like its predecessor from 2021, is a turn-based tactical RPG rooted in Dungeons & Dragons mechanics. The game takes place in a rocky cliffside village where players are tasked with addressing various crises caused by marauding kobolds, mysterious tremors, and a crew of fishermen trapped by giant crabs. Players can choose different approaches to these challenges, such as directly confronting the kobolds or attempting subterfuge by stealing a dragon scale.

The game introduces a refined user interface allowing players to manage skill checks more efficiently, treating the party as a cohesive unit instead of individual characters. This change alleviates frustrations that may arise when players engage in high-stakes situations with less charismatic characters. Additionally, players can navigate characters using the WASD keys, enhancing movement through tighter areas on the map.

Combat mechanics remain akin to traditional RPGs, allowing players to roll for initiative and manage spell slots while benefiting from quality-of-life improvements that streamline gameplay. The interface provides clear access to character abilities, making it easier for players to engage with the mechanics without steep learning curves.

However, while Solasta II demonstrates thoughtful enhancements, it does not significantly differentiate itself from other RPGs, particularly when compared to the highly interactive experiences offered by titles like *Baldur's Gate III*. The demo's structure was more limited, suggesting that while the gameplay mechanics are solid, the game may need to offer greater depth and interactivity to stand out in a competitive market.

author: Ethan Gach
title: PUBG Creator's Next Game Is Very Different But Even More Ambitious
description: Nearly a decade ago, Brendan Greene’s obsession with battle royales fundamentally reshaped gaming. Now the designer, best known by his online moniker “PlayerUnknown,” is toiling away on a new set of projects that could change much more than that if they’re su…
content:
Brendan Greene, also known as “PlayerUnknown,” is developing a new survival sim titled Prologue: Go Wayback!, which aims to redefine online gaming and potentially the internet itself. The project, part of PlayerUnknown Productions, is not a sequel to PUBG: Battlegrounds, but rather a first step towards creating a more expansive digital universe.

In an interview, Greene expressed that the scale of Prologue is often misunderstood, emphasizing his ambition to build a metaverse that stands apart from existing efforts, which have been criticized as empty hype. Prologue is described as a first-person walking simulator set in an 8x8 km open world, where players navigate environmental challenges such as weather and resource management while trying to reach a distant weather tower.

The gameplay involves survival elements without the combat focus of PUBG. Early versions of the game have been likened to a wilderness simulation, with opportunities for self-directed exploration. Greene noted the emergence of player-generated stories, like one player dying of hypothermia after spawning in a harsh environment, showcasing the unpredictable nature of the game.

Prologue employs procedural generation similar to No Man’s Sky, using machine learning to create diverse terrains while allowing developers to refine the environments to encourage interesting gameplay scenarios. Currently, a playthrough lasts one to two hours, but the team is considering increasing the difficulty to enhance the experience.

author: Darryn Bonthuys
title: Space Marine 2 Dev's Next Game Is Based On One Of Hasbro's "Tentpole" IPs
description: After the launch of Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 last year, it looks like developer Saber Interactive will be working on another game based on a famous IP. Hasbro announced this week that Saber Interactive will be bringing one of its "tentpole IPs" to lif…
content:
Saber Interactive is set to develop a new AAA game based on a well-known Hasbro IP. Hasbro CEO Chris Cocks announced during an investor's call that this collaboration follows the success of Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2. The new title will leverage Saber's advanced technology for high-energy single-player and multiplayer action.

While the specific IP has not been revealed, Hasbro owns several franchises, including Transformers, GI Joe, Dungeons & Dragons, Magic the Gathering, My Little Pony, and Peppa Pig. Other projects in development include a new Dungeons & Dragons game by Invoke Studios and a GI Joe spin-off by Atomic Arcade. Fans have expressed interest in a Transformers game, especially since recent titles have not met expectations. Notably, a promising Transformers game, Transformers: Reactivate, was canceled earlier this year.

author: Zosha Millman
title: Nickelodeon is finally giving us a new Avatar: The Last Airbender show
description: We’re getting more new Avatar: The Last Airbender — beyond just the live-action Netflix adaptation, of course. On Thursday, Nickelodeon announced a new Avatar show called Avatar: Seven Havens, set in the world of Avatar: The Last Airbender. The show is create…
content:
Nickelodeon has announced a new show titled **Avatar: Seven Havens**, set in the world of *Avatar: The Last Airbender*. The series is created and co-executive produced by the original co-creators, Michael DiMartino and Bryan Konietzko, and has already been picked up for **26 episodes**, which will be split into two seasons.

The series is set in a world devastated by a cataclysm, following the events of *The Legend of Korra*. It focuses on a young Earthbender who discovers she is the new Avatar. However, in this dangerous era, the Avatar title makes her a target rather than a hero. The plot involves her and her long-lost twin uncovering their origins while facing threats from both human and spirit enemies to save the Seven Havens.

DiMartino and Konietzko expressed their excitement about expanding the Avatar universe, stating, “This new incarnation of the Avatarverse is full of fantasy, mystery, and a whole new cast of amazing characters.”

author: Eddie Makuch
title: GTA 5 On PC Is Getting Better Graphics, Faster Loading Times, And Lots More With Free Upgrade
description: Rockstar Games made a big GTA announcement today, and while it's not anything to do with GTA 6, it's still a pretty significant piece of news. GTA 5 for PC is getting a major upgrade, with Rockstar Games bringing over the changes, improvements, and additions …
content:
Rockstar Games announced a significant upgrade for GTA 5 on PC, bringing over enhancements from the Xbox Series X|S and PS5 versions. This upgrade will be available for free on March 4 for all PC users, supporting story mode and online progress. However, users whose hardware does not meet the minimum requirements can continue playing the existing version of GTA 5 on PC, albeit as a separate instance from the upgraded version.

The upgrade includes new vehicles and enhancements from Hao's Special Works, increased wildlife in the game, and the introduction of the Career Progress feature on PC. Additionally, PC players can now sign up for GTA+ for the first time. To help new players start, Rockstar is offering $4,000,000 worth of in-game currency.

For those with compatible hardware, new technical features will be available, such as ambient occlusion, global illumination, ray-traced shadows and reflections, faster loading times, higher frame rates, higher resolutions, and improved audio with Dolby Atmos. Support for FiveM in the PC version of GTA 5 will continue without interruption.

Rockstar also announced plans to reveal details about the next GTA Online update in March, focusing on "sky-high illicit revenue opportunities" featuring the character Oscar Guzman. Furthermore, the release date for GTA 6 is anticipated later this year, with more information expected soon.

**Minimum System Requirements for Upgraded GTA 5 on PC:**
- OS: Windows 10
- Processor: Intel Core i7-4770 / AMD FX 9590
- Memory: 8 GB RAM
- Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 1630 (4 GB VRAM) / AMD Radeon RX 6400 (4 GB VRAM)
- Storage: 105 GB SSD required
- Sound Card: 100% DirectX 10 compatible

author: Elie Gould
title: 'I expect a lot of people will hate it': PUBG creator Brendan Greene doesn't care if his new game is too hard for players to handle as long as it 'elicits a reaction'
description: We can do this the hard way or the hard way.
content:
Survival games typically present challenges in remote locations where players must manage hunger, hydration, and protection from the environment. In "Prologue: Go Wayback!", this difficulty is significantly heightened.

Brendan Greene, the creator of PUBG, emphasizes his desire to create a brutal gaming experience. He believes many gamers appreciate the challenge that comes without hand-holding. In "Prologue", danger arises not just from enemies but from players’ choices. Mistakes, like attempting risky climbs or crossing cold waters, often lead to fatal consequences. The most persistent threat is the unpredictable weather, which Greene likens to unmanageable opponents in battle royale games.

While a radio can provide weather updates, it consumes valuable backpack space, often leading players to forgo it in favor of supplies. Sudden fog and blizzards can drastically hinder navigation and survival.

Players must plan meticulously, as threats exist both day and night. Hunger and thirst can strike unexpectedly, adding urgency to decision-making. Cabins scattered throughout the map serve as safe havens for warmth, gear, and resources, pushing players to only venture outdoors when absolutely prepared.

During internal testing, developers competed to reach a destination, which took them about an hour and a half on average, showcasing the game’s inherent difficulty. Greene notes, “It’s okay to die and start again,” highlighting the game's learning curve.

author: Elie Gould
title: PlayerUnknown's upcoming game Prologue: Go Wayback! is full of grand ambitions, but there's still a lot of room for this survival game to grow
description: The only way is up.
content:
In PlayerUnknown's upcoming survival game Prologue: Go Wayback!, my first spawn location was in a cabin situated on the edge of what I initially thought was a river, only to discover it was actually a lake. After multiple failed attempts to craft a boat from nearby planks, a developer informed me of a known bug causing cabin placements in the lake. Reluctantly, I swam to shore, cold and hungry.

Once I escaped the lakehouse, I focused on navigating the wilderness with only a compass and map, which was daunting given the game's aim of locating a randomly placed Weather Station. Unlike other survival games, Prologue doesn't provide coordinates or map locations, making navigation reliant on environmental cues, like the direction of moss growth.

The game challenges players with unforgiving mechanics; even cabins, which offer shelter, can be deadly if proper precautions aren't taken against the elements. Despite the initial struggle, moments of success—like starting a fire or finding shelter—are rewarding.

Prologue's difficulty is further emphasized by its barren world, devoid of wildlife or other players, which enhances the sense of isolation.

author: Ryan Dinsdale
title: Pokémon Presents Event Coming Next Week
description: The Pokémon Company has announced that a Pokémon Presents event will provide updates on the franchise next week.
content:
The Pokémon Company has announced a Pokémon Presents event for February 27, 2025, at 6am Pacific / 9am Eastern / 2pm UK, to celebrate Pokémon Day. The event will be available on the Pokémon YouTube channel.

While details are unclear, fans anticipate updates on the next mainline Pokémon game, which has yet to be revealed. The company previously announced a spin-off title, Pokémon Legends: Z-A, set for release in 2025. Additionally, the event typically includes updates on ongoing games like Pokémon Unite, Pokémon Sleep, Pokémon GO, and Pokémon Masters EX, as well as news regarding the Pokémon TCG Pocket and the physical card game.

The last Pokémon Presents took place in 2024, which was notable for only having one event rather than multiple and for being the first year since 2015 without a major Pokémon game release.

author: Oli Welsh, Charlie Hall
title: Space Marine 2 developer is making a game based on ‘tentpole’ Hasbro IP
description: Hasbro, the toy company that owns Dungeons & Dragons, Magic: The Gathering, Transformers, and more, has announced that it’s making a “AAA” video game with the Saber Interactive team that made Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2. The news came straight from Hasbr…
content:
Hasbro has announced that it is developing a “AAA” video game in collaboration with Saber Interactive, the team behind Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2. This announcement was made by Hasbro CEO Chris Cocks during an earnings call, who described the game as based on one of Hasbro’s key intellectual properties (IPs).

Cocks expressed excitement about the project, highlighting the combination of single-player action and multiplayer elements supported by Saber’s technology. He confirmed that the agreement with Saber is a “co-publishing deal” and emphasized the talent of the team working on the game, specifically mentioning the studio responsible for Space Marine 2.

Hasbro is also working on several self-funded video game projects, influenced by the success of Baldur’s Gate 3 and Monopoly Go. These projects include a new Dungeons & Dragons game, a sci-fi role-playing game (Exodus), a G.I. Joe game featuring Snake Eyes, and an unnamed project from Skeleton Key.

author: Eddie Makuch
title: Shocking James Bond Changes Announced, Could Influence Future Games
description: In a shocking announcement, Amazon MGM Studios has announced that it is taking over creative control of the James Bond series as part of a deal with series stewards Barbara Broccoli and Michael G. Wilson. What does this mean for Hitman developer IO's new Jame…
content:
Amazon MGM Studios has announced it will take over creative control of the James Bond series, following a deal with franchise stewards Barbara Broccoli and Michael G. Wilson. While the pair have managed the series for nearly 60 years, they will continue to co-own the Bond IP rights, as part of a new joint venture. However, Amazon MGM Studios will have ultimate creative authority once the deal closes.

Amazon MGM Studios head Mike Hopkins expressed enthusiasm about continuing the Bond legacy and introducing the next phase of the franchise. This transition raises questions about the future of upcoming projects, including IO Interactive's new James Bond game, which aims to tell an original story about the character and kick off a new trilogy.

IO Interactive CEO Hakan Abrak confirmed the game, tentatively titled Project 007, will not be based on any existing Bond films. The game is being developed independently, allowing IO to create a unique interpretation of Bond tailored for gamers.

Historically, James Bond video games have been produced by various developers, with notable titles including Rare's 1997 GoldenEye 007 and games from Electronic Arts and Activision. An updated game hasn't been released for consoles since 2012's 007 Legends, but Cypher 007 launched for mobile in 2023. 

Amazon acquired MGM in 2022, gaining distribution rights to the Bond films, though no new movie has been released since 2021's No Time To Die. With this shift in creative leadership, the timeline for future Bond projects, including films, remains uncertain. No decisions have been made regarding casting, directing or writing the next Bond film.

author: Brandon Morgan
title: 6 Diablo 4-Like Games To Grind Before The ARPG's Next Season
description: Following the success of Diablo IV: Vessel of Hatred, along with the recurring seasonal themes and fresh start opportunities, enjoying the grind brought to us by Blizzard Entertainment is easier than ever. But sometimes it’s not enough. Say, for example, you …
content: Following the success of Diablo IV: Vessel of Hatred, players are looking for ways to enjoy the game while awaiting the next season, likely starting in April. If you've finished a season early, consider trying other ARPGs to pass the time.

author: Jacob Fox
title: Scuf Valor Pro review
description: Feature-rich and featuring near-perfect quality and ergonomics, this controller is lacking in one inconvenient area.
content:
The Scuf Valor Pro is an impressive wired controller priced at $100, offering high-quality features such as mechanical buttons, Hall effect thumbsticks, and customizable back paddles. While its performance enhancements cater to competitive gaming, the lack of wireless connectivity at this price point is a notable drawback for PC gamers, where many prefer keyboard and mouse setups. 

Key specifications include compatibility with Xbox and Windows, USB-C connectivity, and a weight of 260g. Although wired connections can provide better response times for pro-level control, they can also be distracting and limit usability in competitive environments. Ultimately, the Valor Pro appeals to specific gaming genres but may struggle to fit within the broader PC gaming market, where wireless options are often favored.

author: Jason Fanelli
title: Scuf Valor Pro Wired Xbox Controller Review - A Pro Controller That's Light(ish) On The Wallet
description: In order to be successful, a controller needs three things: comfort, function, and convenience. There's a reason why the Duke--the notoriously large controller that accompanied the original Xbox in 2001--was eventually replaced with a smaller design, durable …
content:
In order to be successful, a controller needs comfort, function, and convenience. Scuf's Valor Pro Wired Controller for Xbox and PC excels in these aspects. It is lightweight with a smooth front faceplate, making it easy to hold, and features well-placed bumpers and triggers, along with four rear paddles for enhanced control. Additional features, like built-in audio controls, contribute to its convenience.

The controller feels great for larger hands, with buttons and sticks positioned ideally. While light, it has a sturdy build, and its nonslip grips perform well even with sweaty palms. The sticks are comfortable, featuring a ridged border for cushioning, and incorporate Hall Effect anti-drift measures to ensure durability and precision.

The four back paddles stand out for their resistance to accidental presses, enhancing gameplay. The Valor Pro includes three controller profiles tailored for different game types—shooters, sports games, and racing games—allowing for quick switching of button assignments. Custom remapping is easy, letting users assign paddles to preferred buttons across each profile.

Overall, the Valor Pro offers a well-designed, comfortable experience for Xbox and PC gamers.

author: Joshua Wolens
title: Survival MMO Dune: Awakening launches in May and I am way more excited about it than I thought I'd be
description: Kwisatz Haderach, give the dog a bone.
content:
**Dune: Awakening - Release Date Reveal**

Dune: Awakening, Funcom's survival MMO based on Frank Herbert's universe, has announced its release date for PC on May 20 this year, priced at $50. Console release dates are yet to be determined. The game is set in an alternate timeline of Arrakis where Paul Atreides was never born and features houses Harkonnen and Atreides in a War of Assassins. Players take on the role of a minion dispatched by the Bene Gesserit to find the Fremen and awaken the sleeper.

In the game, players experience a range of activities, including building homes, battling scavengers, and gathering resources in dungeons. While it initially may seem aligned with typical survival and MMO genres, early gameplay reveals engaging exploration and unique combat elements. Additionally, advanced gameplay will involve political maneuvering within the Landsraad, where players can enact laws that benefit them and undermine their rivals. Overall, the combination of survival mechanics and political intrigue promises a compelling experience reminiscent of EVE Online's player-driven narratives.

author: Michael McWhertor
title: A new Pokémon Presents is coming for Pokémon Day 2025
description: A new Pokémon Presents showcase is coming on Feb. 27, The Pokémon Company announced Thursday. The new Presents livestream falls on Pokémon Day 2025, the annual celebration of the monster-catching franchise. February’s Pokémon Presents will stream on official …
content: A new Pokémon Presents showcase is set for February 27, coinciding with Pokémon Day 2025. The livestream will be available on the official Pokémon YouTube and Twitch channels at 9 a.m. EST/6 a.m. PST/2 p.m. GMT/11 p.m. JST. While specific details on the content are not yet announced, updates on Pokémon Legends: Z-A, a new game set in Kalos, are anticipated. Pokémon Legends: Z-A is expected to release on Nintendo Switch in 2025, and possibly on the rumored Switch 2.

author: Darryn Bonthuys
title: WWE 2K25's Showcase Mode Will Let You Relive--And Change--Bloodline History

Mark Delaney of GameSpot praised the game's new features and modes, indicating a positive initial impression but withholding final judgment until a full review is published later.

author: Kenneth Shepard
title: How And Where To Watch The Pokémon Day Presents Showcase
description: It’s that time of year when The Pokémon Company pulls back the curtain on things it’s been cooking up. Pokémon Day, the anniversary of the release of the original Pokémon Red and Green, is February 27, and The Pokémon Company has announced it will be holding …
content:
The Pokémon Company will hold a Pokémon Presents livestream on February 27 at 6 a.m. Pacific / 9 a.m. Eastern to celebrate Pokémon Day and discuss upcoming games, updates, and possibly new anime or merchandise. During the presentation, the first footage of Pokémon Legends: Z-A is likely to be shown. This game, set in Lumiose City, was announced last year but details have been sparse. It is expected to launch this year, marking the start of its marketing campaign.

In addition to RPGs, updates on live-service games such as Pokémon Go, Pokémon Unite, Pokémon Trading Card Game Pocket, and Pokémon Masters EX will be provided. There will also be news about the anime, including an animated short titled "Dragonite and the Postman," which will premiere online that day. 

While Pokémon had a quieter year in 2024, lacking a major new RPG, it also avoided some controversies experienced in 2023, except for issues related to a Game Freak leak.

title: CD Projekt Red Wants Cyberpunk 2077 Sequel To Have Most-Realistic Crowds Ever
description: Near the end of last year, CD Projekt Red shifted its focus away from Cyberpunk 2077 updates and bug fixes and put The Witcher 4 into full production. But that doesn't mean the developer isn't starting work on the next game in the Cyberpunk 2077 franchise. In…
content:
CD Projekt Red has shifted its focus from Cyberpunk 2077 updates to The Witcher 4, but it is also starting work on the next Cyberpunk 2077 game, codenamed Project Orion. The company is seeking a lead encounter designer to create a realistic and reactive crowd system and design memorable combat encounters. 

Despite its rocky launch, CD Projekt Red has addressed major issues in Cyberpunk 2077, and the Phantom Liberty DLC received praise for enhancing the game's world. The development team aims to improve NPC interaction in the sequel, potentially allowing crowd encounters to influence the story more deeply.

While no release date for the sequel has been announced, the game could take several years to develop alongside The Witcher 4. The Witcher 4 director believes the company has learned from past mistakes with Cyberpunk 2077, aiming to avoid repeating them in future projects.
